full_text: This demonstration shows how to change a billing schedule. Ashley is interested to know what her payments would be if she were billed every other week instead of every month. First, I need to confirm that Succeed Insurance offers the option of billing every other week. To do this, I'll go to the Administration tab to look at the list of payment plans. I click the arrow icon for Business Settings in the sidebar. Then I click Payment Plans. I see that PP21 is our every other week payment plan. I'll click on the PP21 payment plan. I confirm that the Payment Interval field is every other week, so this payment plan will satisfy the requirement. Next I'll go back to the Account Summary. I select Ashley Peterson from the drop-down list on the Account tab. Here's the Policy Number link, which will take me to the Policy Summary. Now, I'll click the link in the sidebar to go to the Payment Schedule screen. Here is the payment schedule for this policy. I click Change Payment Plan. The Change Payment Plan screen lets me try out different payment schedules. I click the New Payment Plan field. Now, I'll change the New Payment Plan field to PP21, which is on the second page of the list. I select PP21. Notice the Edit Type column. This shows me what will be reversed, in the case of a billed invoice, removed, or added with this change. As the billing clerk, I inform Ashley, changing from a monthly plan to an every other week plan, your down payment will be $1,440 and the installments will be $98 and either $18 or $19, depending on the date. Ashley isn't sure she wants to make a change at this time, so I simply click Cancel. This concludes our demonstration on changing the payment schedule. segments.text: This demonstration shows how to change a billing schedule. Ashley is interested to know what her payments would be if she were billed every other week instead of every month. First, I need to confirm that Succeed Insurance offers the option of billing every other week. To do this, I'll go to the Administration tab to look at the list of payment plans. I click the arrow icon for Business Settings in the sidebar. Then I click Payment Plans.

I see that PP21 is our every other week payment plan. I'll click on the PP21 payment plan. I confirm that the Payment Interval field is every other week, so this payment plan will satisfy the requirement. Next I'll go back to the Account Summary.
I select Ashley Peterson from the drop-down list on the Account tab. Here's the Policy Number link, which will take me to the Policy Summary.
Now, I'll click the link in the sidebar to go to the Payment Schedule screen. Here is the payment schedule for this policy. I click Change Payment Plan.
The Change Payment Plan screen lets me try out different payment schedules. I click the New Payment Plan field.
Now, I'll change the New Payment Plan field to PP21, which is on the second page of the list.
I select PP21. Notice the Edit Type column. This shows me what will be reversed, in the case of a billed invoice, removed, or added with this change.

As the billing clerk, I inform Ashley, changing from a monthly plan to an every other week plan, your down payment will be $1,440 and the installments will be $98 and either $18 or $19, depending on the date.
Ashley isn't sure she wants to make a change at this time, so I simply click Cancel.
This concludes our demonstration on changing the payment schedule.
